meanings.definition: A mark or symbol used in Hinduism, typically a red dot on the forehead.
meanings.sent1: During the festival, she proudly wore a tika on her forehead.
meanings.sent2: The bride's tika added a touch of tradition to her wedding attire.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child drew a tika on his own forehead with a marker.
meanings.sent4: Her tika shone like a beacon of faith in the crowded temple.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant red tika stood out against her fair skin.

meanings.definition: A type of traditional Maori dance.
meanings.sent1: The community gathered to watch the mesmerizing tika performance.
meanings.sent2: The rhythmic beats of the tika echoed through the marae.
meanings.sent3: The tika dancers gracefully moved to the music, telling stories with their steps.
meanings.sent4: The tika seemed to weave a tale of ancient legends through their movements.
meanings.sent5: The energy of the tika filled the air, captivating everyone present.

meanings.definition: A type of traditional Polynesian tattoo.
meanings.sent1: He proudly displayed his intricate tika on his forearm.
meanings.sent2: The tika on her shoulder symbolized her connection to her heritage.
meanings.sent3: The bold tika on his back told a story of bravery and strength.
meanings.sent4: Her tika seemed to come alive, dancing with the movements of her body.
meanings.sent5: The intricate patterns of the tika were a work of art on his skin.
